text:
We have a few clients who have content hosted on the HubSpot CMS (either their full website and/or landing pages) - these clients also are using OneTrust as a CMP to manage their visitors data-collection preferences (HubSpot's cookie banner doesn't check all the boxes for them).

Major issue I am seeing is that HubSpot doesn't offer a way to conditionally execute the tracking code that is added into the templates automatically - this makes OneTrust implementation tricky, and quite frankly it seems like a massive oversight by HubSpot to not allow for disabling the tracking scripts outside of their own cookie consent banners.

*What is the solution for this? The solution cannot be "use the HubSpot cookie banner" - as it isn't a full featured CMP.*
There is a HubSpot solution that is in Beta right now , it is called "Cookie Screening" which should help with this
how does that help w/ ensuring HubSpots tracking scripts honor the consent preferences stored by onetrust
